instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.03amp
threads.message:
Hi, this board came in with sign from previous repair store : "owner want to cancel, so they undo all their work till it dead again"
anyway, i check that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted, i tried to inject.., then i look around and i found that they put smc with solder blob, removing the smc relieve the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> short.The question is : do my injection kill the smc ?

Anyway i reball the smc, no short on pp3v3, I have checked, with battery, ppbus is around 11v, and have 20v on charger 0amps , doesnt turn on
without charger, only 5v, and taking 0.03amps

i have ldo voltage on pp3v3 and 1v8for both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, 1v1 only appear at the corresponding connected port. ( no short )..
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 2.8v
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 2.2v , removing <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> make both of that voltage 3.3v.. does all this symptom pointing to bad smc ? ( I have tried replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.03amp
threads.message:
The other service did more damage on board for sure.
Do not waste the time with it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.03amp
threads.message: Got it, maybe next time i will straight out refuse such a messed up board :(
